meanings.definition: The juice or sap of a plant.
meanings.sent1: I poured the succus from the plant into a glass.
meanings.sent2: The succus from the orange was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The succus dripped on my shirt, making it look like a plant had hugged me.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like succus, flowing smoothly and nourishing our minds.
meanings.sent5: The succus oozed out of the plant, vibrant and full of life.

meanings.sent1: The succus in the bottle was clear and sparkling.
meanings.sent2: He spilled succus on the floor while trying to pour it into a container.
meanings.sent3: The succus bubbled like a tiny stream, making a soothing sound.
meanings.sent4: The succus of her emotions overflowed, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The succus flowed through the pipes, carrying nutrients to the plants.
